revised_title: Discovery of a Roman Pottery Near Leeds in Yorkshire
tldr: Ralph Thoresby, in his letter to Dr. Martin Lister, describes the discovery of a Roman pottery near Leeds in Yorkshire. He explains the location, the ruins of the furnaces, and the surrounding area. Thoresby also discusses the possibility of the site being a Roman brickmaking facility due to the abundance of clay in the area and the presence of Roman bricks in nearby ruins. He seeks Lister's thoughts on the matter and requests information about Roman metalwork from Santon.
